issue.title: Allow easily bootstrapping an AnnotatedContainer

milestone.title: v1.1 Release
milestone.description: This release will primarily be focused on bug fixes. It may see the addition of an additional Container implementation being supported.

issue.body: Currently the process for going from no-code to a configured `AnnotatedContainer` involves a few steps. It should be possible with Annotated Container CLI to drastically simplify this so that you can have an effective 1-liner if you're configuration is following conventions and a slightly-more-than-1-liner if you're doing something non-convention.

issue.title: Ensure CLI tool is up-to-date and functional

issue.title: Add starndardized method for scanning a vendor package
Add a ContainerDefinition implementation that is profile aware

milestone.title: v1.x and beyond
milestone.description: Features that are intended to be implemented after a 1.0 release, the API has stabilized, and a user-base has been established to warrant the effort required.

issue.body: It would be useful to have a `ContainerDefinition` decorator that knew what profiles were active and then when you retrieved definitions that were profile aware only those definitions matching the active profiles would be included. This type of design would allow all ContainerFactory implementations to reuse profile resolution code and would also allow tooling and other parts of the codebase use the same functionality without it being tied to a ContainerFactory the way it currently is.

issue.title: Allow multiple context consumers in compile options

milestone.description: This release will primarily be focused on bug fixes. It may see the addition of an additional Container implementation being supported.

commits.message: Don't rely on code scanning order for test
Add ability to load custom meta data in XML file
Move from title to unique-verifying id

issue.title: Aliasing an Attribute causes parsing to not recognize it
issue.body: Currently the PhpParserAnnotatedTargetParser is dependent on the Attribute _not_ being aliased and the string value of the Attribute being used MUST exactly match the FQCN. It should be possible to support gathering an Attribute when searching for the FQCN even if uses of that Attribute in the codebase are with an alias.
